title: Gains don't match between simulator and Atlas hardware

content.raw:
The gains don't match between the simulator and the Atlas hardware.  One example is that the various arm position gains in the simulator range from 50-2000.  The arm position gains on the Atlas hardware range from 5-20.

Another example is the gains outside of the default PID gains.  The Atlas hardware has gains of ff_const, ff_f_d, ff_qd, ff_qd_d, k_f_p, k_qd_p, k_q_i and k_q_p.  Three of these correspond roughly to the PID gains, the other 5 are not simulated.
content.html:
The gains don't match between the simulator and the Atlas hardware. One example is that the various arm position gains in the simulator range from 50-2000. The arm position gains on the Atlas hardware range from 5-20.

Another example is the gains outside of the default PID gains. The Atlas hardware has gains of ff_const, ff_f_d, ff_qd, ff_qd_d, k_f_p, k_qd_p, k_q_i and k_q_p. Three of these correspond roughly to the PID gains, the other 5 are not simulated.
